topic: How to type-check stream processing using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to type-check stream processing using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Type-Checking Stream Processing in FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to implement type-checking in stream processing using FastAPI and Python 3.12+. It covers essential concepts, key points, code examples, version notes, and caveats.
key_points: Utilize Pydantic models for type validation
Leverage FastAPI for building APIs with built-in type validation
Handle streams using ASGI (Async Server Gateway Interface)
Use python-multipart library for handling multipart/form-data requests

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, File, UploadFile
from pydantic import BaseModel
class Item(BaseModel):	name: str
app = FastAPI()
@app.post('/items/')
def create_item(file: UploadFile):	item = Item(	name=file.filename	)
return item

from python_multipart import parser
async def receive(scope, receive, send):	await receive(data)	stream = await parser.BytesRunner(parser).run_async(data)	for part in stream:	if part.is_multipart:	await receive(await part.file)	else:	print(part.content)

version_notes: FastAPI version 0.72.0 or later is required for ASGI support
Python-Multipart version 0.12.2 or later is recommended
caveats: Stream processing can be memory-intensive, so proper handling and memory management are crucial
FastAPI currently does not provide built-in support for streaming responses; consider using third-party libraries like FastAPI Streaming Middleware or StreamingResponse
